That's a great ritual to have! Checking the weather forecast before your trip is an excellent way to prepare and pack accordingly. It's amazing how much of a difference it can make in ensuring you're comfortable and prepared for your trip.

By checking the weather forecast, you can:

* Pack the right clothing and gear for the expected weather conditions
* Avoid overpacking or underpacking
* Plan your activities and outings accordingly (e.g., indoor vs. outdoor activities)
* Make adjustments to your itinerary if necessary (e.g., booking indoor attractions on rainy days)

It's also a good idea to check the weather forecast regularly leading up to your trip, as weather conditions can change. You can use websites like AccuWeather, Weather.com, or the National Weather Service (NWS) for accurate and reliable forecasts.

Additionally, you might also want to consider checking the following:

* Sunrise and sunset times to plan your daily activities
* Any weather advisories or warnings for your destination
* The average temperature and humidity levels to pack appropriate clothing
* Any seasonal events or festivals that might affect the weather or your plans

Developing a pre-trip ritual like this can help you feel more prepared, confident, and excited for your trip. It's a great way to set yourself up for a successful and enjoyable journey!
